description:
The Audio / Sound Player Howler.js Lite plugin provides a flexible solution for playing, pausing, and controlling audio files in your application. With simple actions like play, pause, stop, mute, and unmute, this plugin makes it easy to integrate audio playback functionality. It also includes event detection to trigger actions when the audio finishes playing. Whether you're creating a music player, sound effects for a game, or any other audio-related feature, the Howler plugin simplifies the process of managing audio playback.  

ðŸ”” For more advanced audio / sound  functionality check out our Audio / Sound Player Howler.js Pro plugin: https://zeroqode.com/plugin/audio--sound-player-howlerjs-pro-plugin-for-bubble-1695226846562x901274596544197200                                                                                                                                                              

[b]Usage Features:[/b] 

- Control audio playback with actions for play, pause, and stop.
- Mute or unmute the audio during playback.
- Detect when the audio finishes and trigger events accordingly.
- Easily manage audio playback from different parts of your application.
- Reset playback to the start with the stop action.

[size=5][b]Feedback[/b][/size] 

[img width=100% height=auto]https://d999c2fb1571594aedf60232928d50bd.cdn.bubble.io/f1729236873217x586673855127698700/howlerjslite.webp[/img]

[size=5][b]FAQ[/b][/size]

[b]How do I play an audio file using the Howler plugin?[/b]
You can use the "Play A Howler" action to start playing the audio. Just specify the audio file, and the plugin will handle the playback.

[b]Can I pause and resume the audio playback?[/b]
Yes, you can use the "Pause A Howler" action to pause the audio and resume playback at any point.

[b]Is it possible to stop the audio completely?[/b]
Yes, the "Stop A Howler" action allows you to stop the audio, and it will reset the playback to the beginning.

[b]How can I mute or unmute the audio?[/b]
You can mute the audio using the "Mute A Howler" action and unmute it with the "Unmute A Howler" action.

[b]How do I detect when an audio track finishes playing?[/b]
The plugin triggers the event "A Howler Has Finished Playing" when an audio file has completed playback, allowing you to trigger further actions based on this event.

instructions: Add the element to your page and set the audio file to play in the plugin properties. You can now play, pause, etc the audio from within your workflows.
